SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class Bookshelf

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.Bookshelf
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Bookshelf extends Object implements Serializable
Represents a bookshelf with 6 rows and 5 columns to store item tiles. Each tile represents a position on the bookshelf that can hold an item.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Bookshelf

      public Bookshelf()
      Initializes a new instance of the Bookshelf class. The bookshelf is initially empty, with all item tiles set to EMPTY.

    • Bookshelf

      public Bookshelf(Bookshelf other)
      Initializes a new instance of the Bookshelf class with the same contents as another bookshelf.
      Parameters:
      other - The Bookshelf object from which to copy the contents.

  • Method Details

    • setShelfie

      public void setShelfie(ItemTile[][] shelfie)
      Setter for shelfie
      Parameters:
      shelfie - matrix to set

    • maxSlotsAvailable

      public int maxSlotsAvailable()
      Returns:
      the maximum number of slots available in any column of the bookshelf

    • availableSlotsForEachColumn

      public int[] availableSlotsForEachColumn()
      Returns:
      array of 5 integers, representing the number of available slots for the respective column

    • availableSlotsForColumn

      public int availableSlotsForColumn(int column)
      Calculates the number of available slots (empty item tiles) in a specific column of the bookshelf.
      Parameters:
      column - The column index for which to count the available slots.
      Returns:
      The number of available slots in the specified column.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the specified column is out of range.

    • enableColumns

      public ArrayList<Integer> enableColumns(int handsize)
      Creates an arraylist of integers that contains only columns that have enough space to contain the handsize.
      Parameters:
      handsize - size of the players hand.
      Returns:
      arraylist of columns.

    • isFull

      public boolean isFull()
      Returns true if the Bookshelf is full
      Returns:
      true if bookshelf is now full, false if it isn't

    • insertItem

      public void insertItem(ItemTile item, int column)
      Places an item in the lowest cell of a specified column.
      Parameters:
      item - the ItemTile to be inserted
      column - the target column of the insertion
      Throws:
      FullColumnException - if the target column is already full

    • getNumEmptyCells

      public int getNumEmptyCells()

    • findRegions

      public void findRegions(ItemType type, int gid, int row, int column)
      Recursively checks if cells surrounding the one given share the same ItemType of the given cell. If so, sets GroupId accordingly
      Parameters:
      type - ItemType in examination
      gid - GroupId to check and set
      row - row number of the cell
      column - column number of the cell

    • adjacentGroupsElaboration

      public int adjacentGroupsElaboration()
      Assigns a GroupID to every item in the bookshelf
      Returns:
      the number of Groups of adjacent items found in the Bookshelf

    • countGIDoccurrencies

      public int countGIDoccurrencies(int gidToCheck)
      Counts the number of Items in the bookshelf belonging to a given GroupID
      Parameters:
      gidToCheck - GroupID in examination
      Returns:
      number of ItemTiles in bookshelf having the specified GroupId

    • resetGroupIDs

      public void resetGroupIDs()
      Sets every item's groupid to -1

    • stringToMat

      public ItemTile[][] stringToMat(String[][] mat)
      convert a string matrix to an Itemtile matrix
      Parameters:
      mat - string matrix
      Returns:
      matrix of ItemTile

    • printBookshelf

      public void printBookshelf()
      print the bookshelf

    • insertItems

      public void insertItems(ArrayList<ItemTile> items, int column)
      Inserts a list of item tiles into a specific column of the bookshelf. The items are inserted one by one using the insertItem() method.
      Parameters:
      items - The list of item tiles to be inserted.
      column - The column index where the items should be inserted.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the specified column is out of range.
